text.text_translated: Different trends are appearing against consumerism, and one of them is the “buy nothing” trend. The idea started in Canada in the early 1990s, then spread to the United States. There, it became a way for people to say no to spending too much on Black Friday and Cyber Monday during the Thanksgiving weekend. Buy Nothing Day is a day when people try not to buy anything. On that day, people organise various protests and even cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, groups that support Buy Nothing also organise the exchange and repair of items they already own.
